page.title: 01Farmland south of Wykeham
page.content: An intensively farmed area along the flat valley bottom of the Derwent River. Fields are large and mostly arable although quite a lot of land is used for grazing stock. Nearer Wykeham the ground is slightly more hilly and less fertile and used mainly for grazing or rough grazing. There are many plantions, coniferous and deciduous scattered about as well as some semi natural deciduous woodland. Residents are mostly involved in farming and live in a scattering of farms, there being no villages. Access is limited to minor roads and tracks and the scenery attracts few visitors. There is a busy sand and gravel pit providing some jobs in the block at Pheasant Lodge. There is some parkland and the remains of an Abbey near Wykeham.
